attributes.action: SCRAP ROAD PRICING PROPOSALS WHICH COULD SEE MOTORISTS PAYING THE EQUIVALENT OF £60 PER GALLON
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
If the proposals of up to £1.34 per mile are introduced, and your vehicle averages 42 miles per gallon, when you need to travel 40 miles on a peak rated route, you will pay £56.28 in tolls plus the current cost of £4.90 for a gallon, equating to £61.18 PER GALLON.(an increase of 1150% )
Even at the cheapest rate of 2pence per mile, your fuel cost will rise by 17%. How can anyone consider charges of this magnitude?
1.6million people have signed a similar petition, which expired on 210th February.
The government must listen to the people on this issue

rejection.details: Please address the excessive use of capital letters, they make the text very hard to read.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
